Reviews.Title: “No for 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ivan u
Reviews.Content: I have been 3 days in this hotel and they give the room number 03, they dont change the towels any day, we was hearing how water fall down near our room, not al lights from the main lamp works and the lights from the other lamps dont work directly, the room wasnt totally finished, there is not bide and all water go out from the shower. The room is pretty but the service is so bad and when we come we ask in reception were we can buy the roma pass and they didnt know even if there was a near tourist office.The only good thing is the place, because is near the underground and the colusseum. I will never recommend this hotel sorry, but is so bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: tom228
Reviews.Content: We did not regret booking this hotel, it has a great location and we were really happy with our room. A few minor negatives as summed up below, but in general great value for money!! Positives: * Lovely, modern room with very large bed, good furniture and surprisingly spacious * Unexpectedly we got our own private balcony! * Large modern bathroom * Awesome location! * Staff on reception and at breakfast were faultless Negatives: * Our bathroom had a shower that had no head- height shower attachment, meaning you had to hold the shower head throughout the shower * Breakfast wasnt great (but certainly would be unfair to describe it as bad), as reviewer below some fresh fruit would have been good. Overall very pleased with the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: nottinghamsally
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Koru and would definitely return here again. The hotel is clean, smartly decorated and in a perfect location right in the centre of Rome. Our room was a little bit tight but with it being a city centre hotel we hadn't been expecting it to be really spacious. Our room was smartly decorated, had a flat screen tv, a safe and free wifi as well as a very comfy bed. The breakfasts were a standard continental breakfast (I enjoyed them but I've seen from some other reviews that they haven't been to everybody's tastes). However if you wanted, the chef would cook up a huge plate of bacon and eggs to set you up for the day. During our time there, all of the staff that we met or spoke to were helpful, friendly and genuinly wanted us to get the best from our time there. All in all we had a great experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go here”
Reviews.Author: dystrad1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via hotel club. From the start the vibes were bad. They never replied to my emails. When we arrived they had no room for us and transfered us to another hotel. We were told for one night. When we got to the other hotel we were told we had been booked in for the duration of our stay in Rome. Don't go here. Shabby treatment and they are quite happy to lie to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not perfect but much better than most at price”
Reviews.Author: banana9181
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and nice. Good sized room, refreshing decor, free wifi, nice bathroom in a very convenient location near metro and termini station. I stay in a lot of hotels around this price in Italy and many are not so good. I'd happily stay here again. I would say the breakfast was average, nothing special but fine (hence 4 rating not 5), but otherwise a great hotel for the price in central Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TOTHEALEX
Reviews.Content: During our trip there with my wife, we stayed at 3 hotels in Rome altogether. This was the best so far. Excellent location - close to train station and main attractions, wonderfully decorated inside, free internet, good breakfast by Italian standards, very helpful and polite service. Our room was quiet and had an excellent view on the roofs. It was painted immaculate white and we felt very, very comfortable there. It is such a top-notch hotel in comparison with the 3-star hotels we stayed afterwards - what is funny - since we booked rooms in advance, we ended up paying the same price for the this hotel as we did for the 3-star counterparts. Please do not forget to go to the top floor and get to the roof from there - I think most people don't know about the option - the view on the city from there is very nice. It would've made for a 5+ experience if they improved their breakfast - there are too many pastries and too little vegetables and fruit.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and modern decoration”
Reviews.Author: Frezaque
Reviews.Content: It is a very nice hotel with a very good staff. Very clean, well located, good breakfast. Decoration brand new and rasonable prices. Good for romantic trip.

Reviews.Title: “first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: happyt24
Reviews.Content: great hotel,amazing location, walking distance to all attractions. Our room was very spacious with a jaccuzzi bath. Fab breakfast with bacon and eggs. Will be back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great up and coming hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: Sophia C
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights at Hotel Koru in September. Our room was very spacious and clean with a modern finish. The location was superb just five minutes from The Forum and a bit further to the Collesseum!!! Cavour tube was 1 minute walk and a great super Market also 1 min away! Wireless was essential for a trip to Rome and was free and super quick in the rooms. The breakfast was ordinary and there were some facilities lacking (eg. No mini bar and no room service) but the management told us they were working on introducing such features. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We reccommend exploring the streets behind Cavour and the hotel as some smaller restaurants etc are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrevorLLeeds_
Reviews.Content: A very well placed hotel, just a 5-10 min walk from ancient Rome sights. For sightseeing a great hotel and about 10 mins from the station. We had room 406, massive room with a jacuzzi bath and giant size and very comfortable bed. Not all rooms have that facility Hotel was spotless and had pleasant helpful staff. Typical continental breakfast but there was scrambled eggs and bacon as well. Negative side though, there are no drink facilities in the room so after a hard days sightseeing you cant make a cup of coffee. The bar shuts from 2-5 as well but in 4 days there I never saw anyone using it anyway, probably because it is downstairs and was far too warm to sit for a drink and there are plenty of bars nearby Also no alarm clock in room so take your own or remember to book a wake up call. Room 406 is at the front so street noise was a pain especially as the Italian drivers most used button is the horn and it sits on a very busy road.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: jfavet
Reviews.Content: I really loved the hotel, nice Boutique Hotel, which knew to keep it simple... Great location, close to the Colyseum, metro, etc... Excellent service: I forgot some personnal items in the room, and there were able to DHL it to me the next day: nice and helpful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient to Rome Termini Train Station”
Reviews.Author: TallyLassie59
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, prior to embarking a cruise ship at the Port (Civitavecchia). We booked it online; price was good, especially for a Rome hotel. It is within a mile of the Rome Termini train station--that was our reason for booking this one. We flew into Rome and took the train to Rome Termini. The hotel is very nice; old, but well-kept. The room we were given (which was an "upgrade") was large; had a very nice-sized bathroom--bed was comfortable; had a safe for valuables (and the safe worked well); breakfast was included in our stay, and it was very good! Fruits, eggs, bacon, cereals, plenty of coffee, rolls, juice. If we were to ever have occasion to stay in Rome again, we would definitely stay here. Many restaurants, bars, shops, etc nearby--on the same street.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ozb123
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location for seeing the sites in Rome - all in walking distance. We drove from Ciampino Airport and it was very easy to find. Room was superb very modern and stylish for a very reasonable price. Hotel staff were excellent and even gave us free parking for the duration of our stay due to a mix up over our parking booking. On the downside there is no outside space at the hotel and breakfast is in the basement which is a bit dingy. Overall highly recommend for a short stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: liesbetbex
Reviews.Content: I was wondering whether I should write a review about this hotel because everything seems to already have been said: good location, helpful and friendly staff, nice and clean rooms, everything working fine as it should. On the downside, an ample but not so great breakfast buffet. Although I did have the impression by the way the hotel is decorated and equipped, that it might be wearing down sooner than later, everything (airconditioning, shower, elevator, ...) was in perfect order when we stayed there. I have no complaints, but I don't think that I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: papsgoil
Reviews.Content: Avery nice hotel. 10 min.walk from the colloseum. Very clean and spacious rooms with central air conditioning working perfectly! which is surprising for Rome 3-4 star hotels. Its 10-15min. walk from Rome Termini the railway station. Great location, all major tourist attraction are 10-20min. from this hotel. Helpful staff quick check in and check out. Breakfast is good. Overall a nice place to stay..not for budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Gem”
Reviews.Author: hlhf
Reviews.Content: We'd previously booked another hotel down the street but the check-in experience was so horrible we left our bags and went looking for another hotel. We found this one and it was delightful. Staff are splendid, rooms clean and airy, free wireless internet, and the location is such that one can easily walk to both the Forum and Colosseum among other locations. Small restaurants abound and it is almost on top of the Cavour Metro stop. Rooms to the front a bit noisy (busy street), but as the hotel has been open little more than a month it's forgivable.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall, but not 4 stars in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: cosmic4444
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights - the location was okay as it was my main worry, but considering the sights are quite spread out in Rome, you have to pick a base somewhere. The metro station is right next door, and there are lots of nice restaurants in the neighbourhood. The walk from the Spanish Steps took us about half an hour and was perfectly manageable. The Colliseum is 5 minutes away. The rooms were very nice in terms of decor and facilities, however I expected higher quality breakfast - it just seemed like they picked the cheapest possible yogurts and juices, the breakfast just didn't seem well thought through (e.g. the cereal bowls were absolutely tiny, more like jam dishes, and no egg cups for the boiled eggs). On the plus side, they served scrambled eggs and bacon - which is very rare in Italy from my experience! As with the previous review, the aircon did not work for the 2 days we were there, but as the room faced the backstreets, noise wasn't a problem. Another thing to note, is when booking direct, the tax is not included in the quoted rate, so there was an extra charge of 3Eur per person per night.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Koru Roma
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cavour 185, 00184 Rome, Italy
